content.description: I don't believe this problem has ever had an official name, so I gave it one! If you know of it as something else let me know. Sit start in set of pockets, throw to jug, top out on slopers, non holds, and crimps.
content.location: Park at the northeast parking lot. This problem is by the natural cave room with a man made doorway.

content.description: Jugs to crimps and then big toss to a good pocket. Got the name Vans cause I was working this thing and just couldn’t get the pocket and then Kc gets on it in his Vans and gets the FA. Haha
crazy little friction climb that sends up the center of the wall.  provides interesting moves that lead to a crimpy top.
content.location: south facing wall, inside small boulder room east of boy scout cave

content.description: big pockets and huecos that lead right and up to a bold finish.
Nice slabby face climb on technical feet: start to left of dihedral, right hand in obvious slot crimp. Standup & traverse on slopey feet to the same top out as “Unknown Destiny”.

Nice tall problem that starts lower right and moves up and left along positive pockets and up to heuco for easy mantle top out.  route is V0 for tall people, little people will have a harder time.  for the short climbers, cruck is reaching for high pocket below heuco.
content.location: 2nd route right from boy scout cave

content.description: Shares start with slammeroonie but goes up and left instead of to the knee bar. Slightly scary topout but not as scary as slammeroonie.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the punch party boulder.

content.description: mixed variety of holds that lead to pockets and highball finish
Start low and work your way up the rail to a pumpy fun top out.
content.location: located on the west side of the "indie boulder" that forms a little room just east of the boy scout cave.  route is the west most problem and tops out next to the v2 problem "manscaping"

content.description: Super fun steep and pumpy problem with big throws that lead to a hueco and decent crimps to top out on. starting feet are on the pioneer bricks.
content.location: starts at the base of the door on the left hand side.

content.description: great low ball problem that starts laying down, feet out left with crimp and pinch holds that move up with a powerful move up and then right along cool crimps to a big throw and top out
content.location: 40 feet east of boy scout cave and around the bend into a small boulder room. problem is on the north side of "indie boulder" and east of the "manscaping" problem.

content.description: Climb the brick doorway up to the window and then chimney over cement roof or make big reach strait to  roof.  Style points for climbers with cajones to make the roof a dino
steep fun lowball problem. Fun positive moves lead to right hand throw finish and top out.  Located on the north side of "Indie Boulder", inside hidden room just 40 feet right of boy scout cave.
On the same boulder as Warrior Man, to its right. Start at a left hand hueco on the face, and a right hand oblong slot around the corner. Climb up the arete using a pocket and a crimp, and top out.
content.location: Park at the northeast parking lot. This problem is by the natural cave room with a man made doorway.

content.description: The hardest moves are closer to the ground but the topout is definitely the sending crux. Nice big moves traversing right to a bomber knee bar which is mandatory to get up this thing then to some slopey holds topping it out. Really fun.
content.location: Tops out four or five feet to the left of punch party.

content.description: right to left roof traverse
content.location: boulder directly in front of the boy scout cave door

content.description: 3/4 of the way up is the crux. Nice jugs till then. Big left hand Gaston is kinda scary but it’s good. Little bit of choss doesn’t hurt ya. Unless you let it.
content.protection: Two pads cause there’s a rock in the landing. And a spotter.
content.location: Just To the right of terminator t-Rex. Goes up and right.

content.description: easy problem with big holds that leads to a tall finish. can be scary for less than bold newbies.
content.location: follow bend right from the boy scout cave into a small alcove.

content.description: interesting moves lead to a high crimpy crux with adventurous top out
content.location: first route right of the boy scout cave door

content.description: A heel hooking shuffle along the rail that leads to a double heel hook top out
content.location: South boulder and to the east of the boy scout cave. mixed in the little boulder pile that makes up one of the walls in the hidden room.  Directly east of warrior man and facing north.
